objects.description:
The user will be able to install apps and unintall them when needed.

Prerequisite:
Have an internet connection
objects.name: [APP REMOVAL] Verify a market installed hosted app can be installed and removed.

steps.instruction: Open the Marketplace.

steps.expected: The app will be installed to the Homescreen.
steps.instruction: Select an app to install.

steps.expected: User is returned to the home screen.
steps.instruction: Press the home button.
Navigate to the newly installed App.

steps.expected: The app icon will start to pulsate.
steps.instruction: Tap and hold on the App.
Press the "X" icon on the app icon.

steps.expected: The application will be unintalled and removed from the Home Screen.
steps.instruction: Confirm the uninstall prompt.

objects.description:
Verify that when the phone is plugged in and charging, the Alarm goes off correctly at the set time.

#Prerequisites:
#-USB Mass Storage turned OFF
#-Remote Debugging turned OFF
objects.name: [Clock]  Verify the Alarm triggers properly while Charging

steps.instruction: From the Homescreen, navigate to the Clock App
Set an Alarm for 5 Minutes from now

steps.expected: The device begins charging and the battery icon indicates the charging state
steps.instruction: Plug the Phone in to Charge (Plugging into device with USB Mass Storage and Remote Debugging turned off works)

steps.expected: At the set time, the Alarm is triggered and goes off correctly
steps.instruction: Wait 5 Minutes for the Alarm to go off

objects.description:
[Clock]  Verify the Alarm triggers properly while connected to a desktop or laptop via USB

#Prerequisites:
#-Have Remote Debugging turned ON
#-Have USB Mass Storage turned ON
#-A Desktop or Laptop device to connect to via USB
objects.name: [Clock]  Verify the Alarm triggers properly while connected via USB

steps.instruction: From the Homescreen, navigate to the Clock App
Set an Alarm for 5 Minutes from now

steps.expected: The device both recognizes and is recognized as being connected to the desktop or laptop via USB
steps.instruction: Connect the Phone to a desktop or laptop device via USB (With Remote Debugging and USB Mass Storage turned ON)

steps.expected: At the set time, the Alarm is triggered and goes off correctly
steps.instruction: Wait 5 Minutes for the Alarm to go off

objects.description:
The user's adb settings should not be affected by the USB tethering mode being toggled on or off. 

#Pre-requisites: 
#"Remote Debugging" (ADB) option is set to OFF
#"USB Tethering" option is set to OFF
#"Developer Menu" option is set to on in "More Information" view
objects.name: [Settings] Verify the adb setting is not modified when toggling USB tethering mode On/Off

steps.instruction: Go to Settings>Internet Sharing>USB Tethering

steps.expected: USB Tethering is displayed as ON
steps.instruction: Set USB Tethering to ON

steps.expected: Remote Debugging remains set to OFF
steps.instruction: Go to Settings>Developer

objects.description:
The user will be able to tap on the edit button while in the read only view.

Prerequisite:
Have an event created for an offline calendar

steps.expected: Then I shall be taken to the edit event view for that event

objects.description:
The user is brought back to the read only view of an event after hitting the back button from editing an event.

Prerequisite:
Have an event created for an offline calendar

Select a day with an offline event.
Tap on the event.
Tap on the Edit button.

steps.expected: Then I am taken back to the read only view for that event

objects.description:
The user can go to the edit view of an event, even after backing out of the event.

Prerequisite:
Have an event created for an offline calendar
objects.name: Verify if I hit back from editing an offline event and select to edit the event again that I will be taken to the edit event view

Select a day with an offline event.
Tap on the event.

steps.expected: Then I am taken to the edit event screen for that event
steps.instruction: Tap on the Edit button.

steps.expected: Then I am taken back to the read only view for that event
steps.instruction: Tap on the Back button.

steps.expected: Then I am taken to the edit event screen for that event again
steps.instruction: Tap on the Edit button again.

objects.description:
As a user of a device with large internal memory, I want to be able to transfer files to my device's internal memory via USB so that I can effectively utilize available memory to store files for later use on the device.

NOTE:  this feature is still under developments so UX specifics may change.
objects.name: [usb storage] Sharing internal device storage

steps.expected: There are now two additional volumes shown in the file explorer on the computer:  1.) corresponds to the device's SD card; 2.) corresponds to the /data volume on the device.
steps.instruction: Attach the device via USB to computer with "USB Mass Storage" enabled.

objects.description:
As a user of a device with large internal memory, I want to be able to transfer files to my device's internal memory via USB so that I can effectively utilize available memory to store files for later use on the device.

Prerequisites:  device is tethered to the computer via USB; and both volumes are shown in file explorer.

Pictures are available on the computer.
objects.name: [usb storage] copying pictures to internal storage

steps.expected: Gallery app scans all volumes for media.  All copied pictures appear in the gallery.   An $ls in /data directory shows also a listing of these files by name.
steps.instruction: Copy picture files of all known varieties (including *jpg, *png, *bmp, *tiff, etc.)  to internal storage of the device.

objects.description:
As a user of a device with large internal memory, I want to be able to transfer files to my device's internal memory via USB so that I can effectively utilize available memory to store files for later use on the device.

Prerequisites:  device is tethered to the computer via USB; and both volumes are shown in file explorer.

Pictures are available on the /data volume of the device.  Same pictures are not yet available on the computer.
objects.name: [usb storage] copying pictures from internal storage

steps.expected: Pictures are now shown in File Explorer on the computer.
steps.instruction: Copy the pictures from the /data volume of the device.

objects.description:
Prerequisites:  device is tethered to the computer via USB; and both volumes are shown in file explorer.

Pictures are available on the computer.
objects.name: [usb storage] copying pictures from SD card to internal storage

steps.expected:
Files appear now under /data volume.   

If the files were already present in the gallery, then they are not duplicated there.
steps.instruction: Copy pictures from SD card to internal storage, using the computer's file explorer and drag and drop.

As a user, I want to be able to add a number in my call log that is present in both All and Missed tabs to an existing contact.

PREREQUISITES:
#a. Call log has several calls to/from a number not in contacts.
objects.name: Ability to add a number which is in the call log with several entries to an existing contact (All and Missed tab)

steps.expected: Verify several entries in both All and Missed tabs for calls to/from a number which is not in the contacts list.
steps.instruction: Launch the Dialer app and open call log.

steps.expected: Verify the option menu is displayed.
steps.instruction: Long press on the unknown number.

steps.expected: Verify the "select contact" page is displayed.
steps.instruction: Select "Add to an existing contact"

steps.expected: Verify the "edit contact" page is displayed.
steps.instruction: Select a contact available.

steps.expected: Verify the user is taken back to the call log page.
steps.instruction: Change or update name and phone number. Press "update".

steps.expected: Verify the contact is updated with correct name and phone number.
steps.instruction: Launch the Contacts app and then view the contact changed.

objects.description:
UCID: Dialer-005
As a user, when I start dialing a phone number, I want to be shown a list of contacts matching the partially inputted number, allowing me to quickly select the contact to initiate the call instead of continuing to dial the full phone number manually.

PREREQUISITES:
-----
* Address book has 3 contacts (A: 776668999, B:566681232 and C:666812547), the four digits typed (6668) matches as a substring of the 3 contacts phone number.

 NOTE:  These numbers are examples only.  Refer to the UCID above for the requirement to be tested.
objects.name: Call contact from overlay screen showing the matching result

steps.expected: Suggestion result count is 3 and result is first contact (in alphabetical order) of overlay menu.
steps.instruction: Type 4 digits that match with contacts A, B & C (e.g. 6668).

steps.expected: Overlay menu is opened, and the three contacts are shown in alphabetical order.
steps.instruction: Tap on result count.

steps.expected: A call is initiated to the selected contact.
steps.instruction: Tap on a displayed contact.

steps.expected: The user is returned to the dial pad.
steps.instruction: While the call is being established, cancel it by tapping on the "call end" button.

objects.description:
PREREQUISITES:
-----
* Address book has at least one contact stored with prefix and with the four digits dialed that matches as a substring of the contact phone number, i.e +34 657 890
objects.name: Start dialing a number which match with one contact's number with prefix

steps.expected: 1. The contact which matches is shown
steps.instruction: 1. Type four digits of contacts phone numbers, i.e 7890

objects.description:
PREREQUISITES:
-----
* Address book has contact stored with and without prefix which matches with the dialed number
objects.name: Start dialing a number with prefix

steps.expected: 1. Only the numbers which match the country code and then the digits entered will be shown
steps.instruction: 1. Type firstly the country code and then start typing the four digits of contacts phone numbers;

objects.description:
UCID: Dialer-005
As a user, when I start dialing a phone number, I want to be shown a list of contacts matching the partially inputted number, allowing me to quickly select the contact to initiate the call instead of continuing to dial the full phone number manually.

PREREQUISITES:
-----
* Address book has 1 contact with two phone numbers; the four digits typed matches as a substring of the 2 phone numbers.

NOTE:  These numbers are just examples.   Refer to the UCID above.
objects.name: Contact with two matching numbers

steps.expected: The match count suggestion is 2.  It shows a contact with one of the numbers matched.
steps.instruction: On the dialer suggestion area, type the 4 digits that match as a substring of the two phone numbers for the contacts.

steps.expected: Overlay menu is opened and shows two entries.  These entries have the same contact (in this case) but different phone numbers.
steps.instruction: Tap on the match count.

objects.description:
UCID: Dialer-005
As a user, when I start dialing a phone number, I want to be shown a list of contacts matching the partially inputted number, allowing me to quickly select the contact to initiate the call instead of continuing to dial the full phone number manually.

PREREQUISITES:
-----
* Address book has 3 contacts (A:686532455, B:777686727 and C:446864476); only three digits (686) matches as a substring of the three contacts phone number 

NOTE:  These numbers are just examples.  The main point here is to test the User Story shown above.

steps.instruction: Add a digit different from any of the three contacts' substrings  (e.g. 2).

steps.expected: Nothing happens.

objects.description:
PREREQUISITES:
-----
Address book has 5 contacts (A "12345678", B "12399999", C "12340000", D"12348888" and E"12345098"). Phone number of contact A has 3 sequential digits equal to contact B, has 4 sequential digits equal to contact C and D, has 5 sequential digits equal to contact E
objects.name: Match refinement

steps.expected: 1.Contacts A,B,C,D and E are suggested. Check the drop down to the right of  the suggested contact.
steps.instruction:
On the Dialer Suggestion Area:
1. Type 3 sequential digits of contact A "123";

steps.expected: 2.In suggestion result count is 4 (A,C,D,E) and result if first contact (A);
steps.instruction: 2. Type 4th digit of contact A "1234";

steps.expected: 3.Result count is 2 (A, E) and result is first contact (A);
steps.instruction: 3. Type 5th digit of contact A "12345";

steps.expected: 4.Result count is 1 and result is contact A;
steps.instruction: 4. Type 6th digit of contact A "123456";

steps.expected: 5. Call is made to contact A
steps.instruction: 5. Tap on result

-----

NOTE:  These numbers are just examples.  Please refer to the UCID above.

steps.expected: Suggestion area is now empty.

If this is the "Keyboard" test suite, you should have the "UI Test App".  Install it as follows:

steps.expected: Music app opens and you can see the Music Home page.
steps.instruction: Open the music app.

steps.expected: Search bar should be visible.
steps.instruction: Pull down at the top of the list content.

steps.expected: All songs matching the string are displayed.  The search performed should search your entire music library to find all instances of the string you have typed.

steps.expected: The Search bar should close and no longer be visible.
steps.instruction: Select the "X" on the left hand side of the search bar.

objects.name: Verify user can create a CALDAV calendar event with a 1 day alarm reminder before event

steps.expected: Calendar opens in Month view
steps.instruction: Tap Calendar App

steps.expected: Selected day is highlighted
steps.instruction: Tap day event user wants created

steps.expected: Event creation screen opens
steps.instruction: Tap plus sign in upper right of device

steps.expected: Title field is editable
steps.instruction: Tap Title

steps.expected: Text entered in Title field displays
steps.instruction: Enter text in Title field

steps.expected: Where? field is editable
steps.instruction: Tap Where?

steps.expected: Text entered in Where? field
steps.instruction: Enter text in Where? field

steps.expected: Calendar selection screen appears
steps.instruction: Tap calendar account field

steps.expected: CALDAV calendar account is highlighted with blue check mark to right

steps.expected: User returned to Event creation screen with CALDAV calendar account showing in calendar account field
steps.instruction: Tap OK

steps.expected: Reminder selection screen displays
steps.instruction: Tap None beneath Remind me

steps.expected: 1 day before is highlighted with blue check mark to right
steps.instruction: Tap 1 day before

steps.expected: User returned to Event creation screen with 1 day before alarm reminder displayed
steps.instruction: Tap OK

steps.expected: User returned to Calendar in Month view with Event displayed in lower right with bell indicating alarm
steps.instruction: Tap Save in upper right of device

steps.expected: Event displays showing CALDAV calendar event with 1 day reminder alarm
steps.instruction: Tap Event
